medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has had severe myopia since infancy, with the current severity being around -14.00D bilaterally. The myopia has required corrective glasses and has shown no signs of retinal detachment despite thinning retinas. Development and daily function have been adjusted by the patient despite this condition.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent excision of the occipital meningocele on day 6 of life and a posterior fossa craniotomy for cyst fenestration at 16 months old without any complications.
